clinical_study.brief_title: Blended Oil Beneficial for Blood Lipids Management
clinical_study.official_title: Blended Oil Beneficial for Blood Lipids Management

collaborator.agency: Agency for Science, Technology and Research

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the effects of two types of oil blends on blood lipid profile, glucose homeostasis, body composition, gut microflora and other markers of cardiometabolic disease risk in Chinese men and women with borderline hyperlipidemia

detailed_description.textblock: The primary aims of this study is to evaluate the effects of consumption of two separate blends of cooking oil, containing rice bran, flaxseed and sesame oils, for a period of 8 weeks, on blood total cholesterol, total triglycerides, low-density and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol and metabolism in borderline hyperlipidaemic, 50 to 70 years old, Chinese, male and postmenopausal female, as compared to refined olive oil. The secondary aims of the study is to evaluate the effect of the two separate blends of cooking oil on markers of cardiometabolic diseases risk (including body composition, glucose homeostasis, markers of oxidative stress and chronic inflammation) and changes in gut microbiota composition and function.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline serum total cholesterol
primary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected in plain serum tubes after an overnight fast, centrifuged and frozen within 2 hours of collection

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline serum low density lipoprotein cholesterol

secondary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected in plain serum tubes after an overnight fast, centrifuged and frozen within 2 hours of collection

secondary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected in EDTA tubes after an overnight fast, centrifuged and frozen within 2 hours of collectionBlood will be collected in EDTA tubes after an overnight fast, centrifuged and frozen within 2 hours of collection

secondary_outcome.description: Blood will be collected in EDTA tubes after an overnight fast, centrifuged and frozen within 2 hours of collectionBlood will be collected in EDTA tubes after an overnight fast, centrifuged and frozen within 2 hours of collection

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in body fat composition percentage
Change from baseline in bone mineral density
Change from baseline in blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using Omron blood pressure monitor after an overnight fast in a seated posture, at rest. Blood pressure measured for a minimum of 3 times and the average of the final 2 readings were taken, ensuring that they were within 10 mmHg of each other.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in gut microflora composition
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using gut metagenome and metatranscriptome profiling

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in gut microflora function
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using gut metagenome and metatranscriptome profiling

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Body weight
Change from baseline in segmental % body fat

arm_group.description: BO1, propriety blend of cooking oil containing rice bran, flaxseed and sesame oil blended at proportions different from 'Blended Oil 2
BO2, propriety blend of cooking oil containing rice bran, flaxseed and sesame oil blended at proportions different from 'Blended Oil 1

intervention.description: Consumption of chicken dishes made with ROO for a period of 8 weeks
Consumption of chicken dishes made with BO1 for a period of 8 weeks
Consumption of chicken dishes made with BO2 for a period of 8 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and post-menopausal female,
- Chinese ethnicity
- Age ≥50 and ≤70 years
- LDL cholesterol (measured) ≥3.06 mmol/l and ≤4.51 mmol/l
Exclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index (BMI) > 27.5 kg/m2.
- Having allergies / intolerances to the foods in the meal accompaniments of the study
- Having undergone bariatric surgery
- Having fasting glucose ≥7.0 mmol/l
- Having heart, kidney (nephrotic syndrome), blood or thyroid dysfunctions
- History of chronic liver diseases including NAFLD, liver cirrhosis or hepatic fibrosis or having history of HIV, Hep-B or Hep-C virus
- Having prescription medication or Traditional Chinese Medicine or supplements known to affect blood lipid metabolism, in the opinion of the study investigators, in the last two weeks prior to screening
- Having diabetes or chronic gastrointestinal disorders
- Following any special diets (for medical or aesthetic reasons)
- Smoking
- Having had diarrhea in the last 3 months
- Having taken antibiotics in the last 3 months
